intro: Bonnaya rothii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Bonnaya rothii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
